newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kohl says opposes German referendum on Euro.
newsitem.headline: Kohl says opposes German referendum on Euro.

text.p: Chancellor Helmut Kohl said he was opposed to the idea of a German referendum on the introduction of the planned single European currency, the euro.

Asked about the introduction of the euro, Kohl referred to the dangers of Germany's politically volatile prewar Weimar period. He said the framers of Germany's postwar constitution had reason not to allow for popular referendums on national issues.
Kohl says opposes German referendum on Euro
Kohl said he was confident a clear majority of Germans would be in favour of the euro.
"I am confident that when this is realised, and people have all the information, that we will get a clear majority of the population for the euro," he said.
A majority of businesses were already in favour of the single currency, he said.
